title: West Pakistan Government Educational and Training Institutions Ordinance, 1960
title_en: West Pakistan Government Educational and Training Institutions Ordinance, 1960
description: Official consolidated text of West Pakistan Government Educational and Training Institutions Ordinance, 1960 (XI of 1960) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 18. Regulations
provisions.content:
INSTITUTIONS ORDINANCE, 1960
WEST PAKISTAN ORDINANCE No. XI of 1960
[6th April, 1960]
AN
to establish Boards of Governors for Government Educational and Training Institutions in West
Pakistan.
Preamble.– WHEREAS it is expedient to establish Boards of Governors for some Government
educational and training institutions in West Pakistan for the efficient management and control thereof;
NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Presidential Proclamation of the seventh day of
October, 1958, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Governor of West Pakistan
is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:__

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title and application. (1) This Ordinance may be called the West Pakistan
provisions.content:
Government Educational and Training Institutions Ordinance, 1960.
(2) It shall apply to such institutions and from such date as may be notified by Government.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions
Section 3. Incorporation. (1) For the efficient management and control of an institution there shall be
provisions.content:
established a Board of Governors.
(2) The Board shall be a body corporate, shall have perpetual succession and a common seal,
with power to enter into contracts and to acquire and hold property, movable and immovable, and shall
in its corporate name sue and be sued.

provisions.title: Section 4. Constitution of the Board. (1) The Board shall consist of not more than nine Members to
provisions.content:
be appointed by the Governor of West Pakistan.
(2) One of the Members shall be appointed by the Governor of West Pakistan to be the
Chairman of the Board.
(3) Official Members, if any, shall be appointed by designation.
(4) Non-official Members, if any, shall hold office for a period of three years and shall be
eligible for re-appointment.

provisions.title: Section 5. Removal of a Member. The Governor of West Pakistan may remove any Member before
provisions.content: the expiry of his term of office without assigning any reason therefor.

provisions.title: Section 7. Meetings of the Board. The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and at such
provisions.content: places and in accordance with such procedure as may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Section 8. General powers of the Board. Subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance the Board
provisions.content:
shall have full powers to administer and manage an institution and in particular in respect of the
following matters:__
(a)     to acquire and dispose of property and generally to enter into contracts, in
conformity with the purposes of this Ordinance;
(b)     recruitment and determination of the terms and conditions of service of the
Principal and other members of the staff of the institution and of other officers
and servants of the Board;
(c)     to formulate the budget of the institution for approval of Government;
(d)     to set up an Executive Committee and other Standing Committees as may be
required for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance;
(e)     to delegate powers to the Chairman the Executive Committee, Standing
Committee, the Principal, the staff of the institution and other officers and
servants of the Board; and
(f)     to frame, subject to the approval of Government, regulations for the conduct of
business of the Board.

provisions.title: Section 9. Transitional provisions regarding staff. Any person serving in connection with the affairs
provisions.content:
of the Province, in an institution in any capacity immediately before the day notified under sub-section
(2) of section 1, hereinafter referred to as the “said day”, may be transferred by Government for service
under the Board on such terms and conditions as Government may determine; provided that such terms
and conditions shall not be less favourable than those admissible to him under Government; provided
further that no such person shall be dismissed, removed from service or reduced in rank by an authority
subordinate to that by which he was appointed.

provisions.title: Section 10. Property. All property, movable or immovable, vesting in Government in connection with
provisions.content:
the affairs of the institution immediately before the said day shall vest in the Board. In the event of
Government rescinding the notification made under sub- section (2) of section 1, the property vesting
in the Board shall stand transferred to Government.

provisions.title: Section 11. Board Fund. (1) There shall be a fund to be known as “Board Fund” vested in the Board
Section 12. Maintenance of accounts. The Board shall maintain complete and accurate books of
provisions.content: accounts in such form as may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Section 13. Annual financial statement. The Board shall submit a statement of estimated receipts and
provisions.content:
expenditure in respect of the next financial year to Government for approval, at such time and in such
manner as may be prescribed and shall give effect to any modifications made therein by Government.

provisions.title: Section 14. Returns and statements. (1) As soon as may be after the close of every financial year but
provisions.content:
not later than the last day of September next following, the Board shall submit to Government for
approval a report on the conduct of the affairs of the Board for that year.
(2) Government may require the Board to furnish Government with__
(a)    any return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information or report
regarding any matter under the control of the Board, or
(b)    a copy of any document in the charge of the Board,
and the Board shall comply with every such requisition.

provisions.title: Section 15. Audit. (1) The accounts of the Board shall be audited in such manner as may be prescribed
provisions.content:
(2) Copies of the audit report shall be sent to the Board and with the comments of the Board to
Government.
(3) The Board shall carry out any directive issued by Government for rectification of an audit
objection.

provisions.title: Section 16. Chairman, Members and employees to be public servants. The Chairman and the
provisions.content:
Members of the Board, the members of the Executive Committee and the Standing Committees
constituted under this Ordinance, the officers and the servants of the institution and other officers and
servants appointed under this Ordinance shall be deemed to be public servants within the meanings of
section 21 of the Pakistan Penal Code (XLV of 1860).
